section "Compilers and Tools" (or just strg+f for CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE)

answer: standard is camel case, and it might also prevent cmake from using the corresponding variables when using a different format (unless you want to prevent it from doing so anyway for some reason).
I don't think stuff like "set (CMAKE_C_FLAGS "${CMAKE_C_FLAGS_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}}")" that you have in your code is necessary when using the proper format for CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE.
